definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
fire ant (Solenopsis invicta), an introduced species in China

sentences.english: Business was good enough to hire a helper.
sentences.chinese: 生意红火，还雇了个帮工。

sentences.english: Red fire ants like these in the American south have gotten a bad rap in our world.
sentences.chinese: 可以说，南美洲出现的这种红火蚁已经是声名狼藉。

sentences.english: In fact, when it's on the ground, the dragonfly looks like it's drowning in fire ants.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，在地面上，蜻蜓就像淹没在红火蚁中一样。

sentences.english: See the net that is like flourishing swim business also undercurrent is billowy .
sentences.chinese: 看似红火的网游业务也暗潮汹涌。

sentences.english: The nest of RIFA scattered in the village.
Red fire ants are very aggressive and readily attack anything that disturb them.
sentences.chinese: 红火蚁攻击性强，容易攻击任何干扰它们的生物。

sentences.english: Their businesses have heat up as quickly as the weather.
sentences.chinese: 他们的生意随着天气变热也越做越红火。

sentences.english: The other 4 kinds of insecticides can't c…
sentences.chinese: 其余4种农药不能达到快速杀灭红火蚁的要求。

sentences.english: With the rapid development of lighting industry, lighting design which can be said as thriving.
sentences.chinese: 照明产业发展迅速，照明设计可以说是红红火火。

sentences.english: The party was jumping when we left.
sentences.chinese: 当我们离开时，晚会正进行得红红火火。
科学家们想知道红火蚁是如何实现漂浮的。

sentences.english: The group's diminutive founder, Jack Ma, smiles that business is "pretty good".
sentences.chinese: 集团的创始人马云，笑言“生意红火”。

sentences.english: Barbecue with apricot wood of fire burns bumps, the fire and smoke-free.
sentences.chinese: 烧烤时要用杏木疙瘩烧旺的红火，须火旺而无烟方可。

sentences.english: The other 4 kinds of insecticides can't completely kill all ants in this trail.
sentences.chinese: 其余4种农药不能达到快速杀灭红火蚁的要求。

sentences.english: Near Cow street, some of Halal restaurants are also very popular.
sentences.chinese: 靠近牛街附近的一些清真餐厅也是人气红火。

sentences.english: Is the stock market smoking hot or just smoking something?
sentences.chinese: 美国股市现在究竟是一片红火，还是一塌糊涂？

definition: becoming more prosperous with each passing day
thriving and prosperous business or trade
both fame and fortune (idiom)/both virtue and reward
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
(a product) sells well/to be in demand
to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
lit. there are principles behind making money (idiom); fig. to have a knack for good business/knowing how to accumulate wealth/good at feathering one's own nest
to climb step by step/to rise steadily/on the up and up
